intro: Roella ciliata var. elongata, commonly known as the longleaf roella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
